perturbation.original_text: Royalty statements (which statements shall be on the form attached hereto as Exhibit O and incorporated herein by this reference or such other form as the receiving party may designate in its discretion) shall be due and payments made within thirty (30) days after the close of each calendar quarter in which the paying party received any applicable revenue. Each party shall keep a record of all sales and shall submit, together with the royalty statements, a quarterly summary report of such sales. Notwithstanding the foregoing, pursuant to Paragraphs 7(b) (2) and 7(b)(3), Fox shall make all payments of revenue remitted directly by VGSL or any other CSP with whom the parties prospectively agree Fox will receive revenue directly, within thirty (30) days of receipt of such revenue.
perturbation.changed_text: Royalty statements (which statements shall be on the form attached hereto as Exhibit O and incorporated herein by this reference or such other form as the receiving party may designate in its discretion) shall be due and payments made within sixty (60) days after the close of each calendar quarter in which the paying party received any applicable revenue. Each party shall keep a record of all sales and shall submit, together with the royalty statements, a quarterly summary report of such sales. Notwithstanding the foregoing, pursuant to Paragraphs 7(b) (2) and 7(b)(3), Fox shall make all payments of revenue remitted directly by VGSL or any other CSP with whom the parties prospectively agree Fox will receive revenue directly, within thirty (30) days of receipt of such revenue.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the payment deadline for royalty statements in the first sentence to sixty (60) days, while the subsequent sentence specifies that Fox shall make payments of revenue remitted directly by VGSL or any other CSP within thirty (30) days. This creates ambiguity as to whether the 30-day or 60-day payment deadline applies to Fox's payments, creating uncertainty and potential disputes over payment obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Late Payments: If a party does not receive the applicable royalty payment as specified on or before the thirtieth day after the close of any calendar quarter, the party owing such royalty shall pay interest with respect to any royalties owed from day to day until the date of payment at a rate of 5% above U.S. Prime Rate on an annual basis. Interest on royalties owed calculated in accordance with this Paragraph shall accrue after as well as before any judgment. Neither the acceptance of any payment or royalty statement nor the deposit of any check shall preclude a party from questioning the correctness of any such payment or royalty statement at any time.
perturbation.changed_text: Late Payments: If a party does not receive the applicable royalty payment as specified on or before the thirtieth day after the close of any calendar quarter, the party owing such royalty shall pay interest with respect to any royalties owed from day to day until the date of payment at a rate of 5% above U.S. Prime Rate on an annual basis. However, no interest will be charged for the first 60 days of late payment. Interest on royalties owed calculated in accordance with this Paragraph shall accrue after as well as before any judgment. Neither the acceptance of any payment or royalty statement nor the deposit of any check shall preclude a party from questioning the correctness of any such payment or royalty statement at any time.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by adding a clause stating that no interest will be charged for the first 60 days of late payment, while the preceding sentence specifies that interest shall be paid from day to day until the date of payment at a rate of 5% above U.S. Prime Rate. This contradiction creates confusion and uncertainty about when interest accrues on late royalty payments, leading to potential disputes over financial obligations.

perturbation.original_text: In the event of termination of this Agreement and without limitation of Fox’s rights and remedies all of which are expressly reserved, the following payment penalties shall apply: (i) if termination occurs in the first year of the Term, Licensee shall forfeit any Guarantee paid, and shall immediately pay any remaining Guarantee, up to the amount of ***** dollars (US$*****), and any Guarantee payments made in excess of ***** dollars ($*****) shall be refunded by Fox to Licensee; and (ii) if termination occurs in the second year of the Term, Licensee shall forfeit any Guarantee paid, and shall immediately pay any remaining portion of the Guarantee then unpaid, up to the amount of ***** dollars (US$*****). Any forfeited Guarantees will apply as a set off against any additional damages claimed by Fox.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event of termination of this Agreement and without limitation of Fox’s rights and remedies all of which are expressly reserved, the following payment penalties shall apply: (i) if termination occurs in the first year of the Term, Licensee shall forfeit any Guarantee paid, and shall immediately pay any remaining Guarantee, up to the amount of ***** dollars (US$*****), and any Guarantee payments made in excess of ***** dollars ($*****) shall be refunded by Fox to Licensee; and (ii) if termination occurs in the second year of the Term, Licensee shall forfeit half of any Guarantee paid, and shall immediately pay any remaining portion of the Guarantee then unpaid, up to the amount of ***** dollars (US$*****). Any forfeited Guarantees will apply as a set off against any additional damages claimed by Fox.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction because in the second year of termination licensee would forfeit ALL guarantee paid, but now it would only forfeit HALF of the guarantee paid.
